page.title: 02WATER EXTRACTION, CRUMMOCK.
page.content: Crummock Water is 4km long with a maximum depth of 43.9m and has a volume of 66.4 million cu.m. Crummock Water is the main domestic water source for Allerdale District i.e. Cockermouth, Harrington, Workington, Maryport and parts of Aspatria. It supplies up to 31,822 cu.m. per day. The water is pumped to Cornhow treatment works where it undergoes purification. Some Lakeland water is relatively pure so that it only needs Chlorine added to destroy bacteria. The water from Crummock, however, is passed through fine microstrainers to remove organic debris. A sample of water is taken weekly to Workington laboratory for extensive analysis, to ensure that water released into the public supply is safe to drink. Tests for Chloride & Fluoride levels & pH are undertaken daily at Cornhow.
